subject: Home & DIY
title: Dark Colors Can Open Up a Room
description: Learn Dark Colors Can Open Up a Room in one minute.

hook.text: Everyone says dark paint makes rooms smaller. Some of the world's best designers paint tiny rooms pitch black.

buildup.text: The 'dark rooms feel small' rule assumes poor lighting. With deliberate light placement, dark walls recede into shadow.

discovery.text: Dark colors blur wall boundaries, making it harder for your eye to detect where the room endsâ€”creating perceived depth.

twist.text: A dark ceiling in a narrow hallway makes it feel like looking into a deep well rather than a cramped tunnel.

climax.text: The trick is contrast: a dark envelope with bright furniture and art draws focus inward, away from dimensions.

punchline.text: Darkness doesn't shrinkâ€”it hides the edges.

quiz.question: How can dark wall colors make a room feel more spacious?
options: They blur wall boundaries so the eye can't detect room edges
They reflect more light than lighter colors
They absorb sound, making the room feel quieter
